title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.167 - Executive Order No. 167: Directing that the Adjutant General Order into Active Service the Organized Militia to Assist Civil Agencies and Authorities in New York State in Disaster Recovery Efforts. [DAGGER][DOUBLE DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.167 - Executive Order No. 167: Directing that the Adjutant General Order into Active Service the Organized Militia to Assist Civil Agencies and Authorities in New York State in Disaster Recovery Efforts. [DAGGER][DOUBLE DAGGER]
State Regulations
NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, under the Military Law of the State, effective March 13, 1993, have
directed the Adjutant General to order into the active service of the State, for such period, to such extent, and in such manner as he may deem necessary, all or any part of the organized militia to assist civil agencies and
authorities in the disaster recovery efforts necessitated by a severe winter
storm with heavy snowfall and high winds which has caused coastal and inland
flooding, the interruption of essential public services and utilities, severe
coastal erosion, the destruction of flood prevention structures, and the
disruption of vital public transportation systems throughout New York State
beginning on March 13, 1993. (1)

Brigadier General Michael S. Hall, the Adjutant General, is appointed commander
of all personnel ordered into the active service of the State. (2)

Units and members of the organized
militia who shall perform State active duty by order of the Adjutant General
will immediately assemble at their local armories when so ordered, and will
remain assembled pending further orders as to their disposition by the Adjutant

General. (3)

All enlistments, re-enlistments or voluntary extensions of enlistments which expire after March
13, 1993, or during the period for which the members are currently ordered into
the active service of the State are hereby extended for the duration of such
duty in the active service of the State. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: March 15, 1993
